en_title: HKSAR and High People's Court of Guangdong Province sign framework arrangement on legal exchange and mutual learning (with photos)
zh_title: 香港與廣東省高級人民法院簽署法律交流互鑑框架安排（附圖）

en: The Secretary for Justice, Ms Teresa Cheng, SC, signed a framework arrangement with the President of the High People's Court of Guangdong Province, Mr Gong Jiali, on exchange and mutual learning in legal aspects between Hong Kong and Guangdong (the Arrangement) in Shenzhen today (September 7) to strengthen legal exchange and collaboration in the Greater Bay Area.

The Arrangement will facilitate courts in Guangdong and relevant legal bodies in Hong Kong to launch projects on legal aspects for mutual exchanges and collaboration to enhance the legal development and safeguard in the Greater Bay Area.

Ms Cheng also attended a seminar organised by the Department of Justice, the High People's Court of Guangdong Province and the Shenzhen Intermediate People's Court under the Arrangement.The seminar on September 7 gathered Mainland judges to discuss the development of judicial scrutiny of arbitral awards.
Ms Cheng together with some 30 members of legal sector will continue to attend the seminar in the series in Shenzhen tomorrow (September 8) and return to Hong Kong on the same day.
zh: 律政司司長鄭若驊資深大律師今日（九月七日）在深圳與廣東省高級人民法院院長龔稼立簽署《廣東省高級人民法院與香港特別行政區政府律政司就大灣區法律交流與互鑑的框架安排》（框架安排）
框架安排將促進廣東法院與香港有關法律機構建立項目，進行法律交流與協作，一同建設及完善大灣區的司法服務和保障。
鄭若驊其後出席由律政司、廣東省高級人民法院及深圳市中級人民法院在框架安排下合辦的一系列講座。九月七日的講座集合內地法官探討仲裁裁決的司法審查的發展。
鄭若驊明日（九月八日）早上會聯同三十多位香法律界人士前往深圳繼續出席此系列講座，並於同日返港。

The Arrangement will facilitate courts in Guangdong and relevant legal bodies in Hong Kong to launch projects on legal aspects for mutual exchanges and collaboration to enhance the legal development and safeguard in the Greater Bay Area.

Ms Cheng also attended a seminar organised by the Department of Justice, the High People's Court of Guangdong Province and the Shenzhen Intermediate People's Court under the Arrangement.The seminar on September 7 gathered Mainland judges to discuss the development of judicial scrutiny of arbitral awards.
Ms Cheng together with some 30 members of legal sector will continue to attend the seminar in the series in Shenzhen tomorrow (September 8) and return to Hong Kong on the same day.
